txt.en:
'It is worse than I expected, [placeholder]: Balin's final lot was grim. I have not yet read all, but there is much here we should take as a warning. They were greatly outnumbered, but seemed not to know this until it was too late.

'Return to the Chamber of Leadership off the Twenty-first Hall, in Zelem-melek, and tell my cousin Brogur to be more cautious. I am worried that if we do not take lessons from Balin's expedition, we may be doomed to his fate.

'Perhaps I am overreacting -- indeed I hope that is the case. Regardless, bring my warning to Brogur as quickly as you may.'

'My cousin has always worried too much. Balin came to a bad end, yes, but this time it will be different. Look at all the victories we have already had, and in so short a time!\n\n'We will be fine, [placeholder]. Do not heed Bósi's groundless worrying. He always does this. Moria has cost us so much already; surely the worst is behind us.'
'Brogur is still in the Chamber of Leadership, off the Twenty-first Hall in Zelem-melek. Bring him my warning as quickly as you may, for these tidings make me uneasy.'
Bósi has read more of the Book of Mazarbul, and is worried about Brogur's haste.

Brogur is in the Chamber of Leadership off the Twenty-first Hall, in Zelem-melek.\n\nBósi is worried by what he has read of Balin's fate in the Book of Mazarbul, and wants you to warn his cousin to be more cautious.
